cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 1360 MI...2185 KM WSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP1 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Hurricane Fernanda Advisory Number 19 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP062017 800 AM PDT Sun Jul 16 2017
...CATEGORY FOUR HURRICANE FERNANDA MOVING WEST-NORTHWESTWARD...
SUMMARY OF 800 AM PDT...1500 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...12.4N 127.4W ABOUT 1360 MI...2185 KM WSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...130 MPH...215 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...WNW OR 285 DEGREES AT 13 MPH...20 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...953 MB...28.15 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 800 AM PDT (1500 UTC), the center of Hurricane Fernanda was located near latitude 12.4 North, longitude 127.4 West. Fernanda is moving toward the west-northwest near 13 mph (20 km/h) and this motion is expected to continue with some decrease in forward speed during the next couple of days.
Maximum sustained winds are near 130 mph (215 km/h) with higher gusts. Fernanda is a category 4 hurricane on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale. Some fluctuations in strength is possible today, with gradual weakening expected on Monday.
Hurricane-force winds extend outward up to 30 miles (45 km) from the center and tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 80 miles (130 km).
The estimated minimum central pressure is 953 mb (28.15 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 200 PM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Brown
NNNN
